title: Kenai Fjords National Park: Distance Learning
body: Distance Learning       Kenai Fjords National Park is now offering several chances to participate in our "Distance Learning" education programs. For those who may never get the chance to experience Kenai Fjords up-close, this is a great opportunity to learn about this unique and beautiful landscape.          Results   Showing results 1-2 of 2    Sort By:  Title Date         Kenai Fjords National Park Conservation Career Opportunities for Youth    This program will give students a chance to learn about careers in the National Park Service, and discuss job and internship opportunities in the conservation field available to ages 15 and up.    Type:Distance Learning Grade level:Eighth Grade-Twelfth Grade Subjects:Career Studies, Conservation, Environment, Leadership, Science and Technology, Service Learning National/State Standards:Aligns with college and career readiness aspects of the Common Core Standards and Career and Technical Education (CTE). Keywords:career, internship, job opportunities, Conservation, environmental education        Kenai Fjords National Park What is Our Role in Ocean Stewardship?    This program will focus on the impacts and potential hazards of marine debris. In a facilitated dialogue format, a park ranger will engage students in a meaningful conversation about our role in protecting the ocean that we all share.    Type:Distance Learning Grade level:Tenth Grade-Twelfth Grade Subjects:Conservation, Earth Science, Ecology, Environment, Marine Biology, Oceanography, Oceans, Wildlife Biology National/State Standards:HS-LS2 Ecosystems: Interactions, Energy, and Dynamics; HS-LS2-7HS-LS4 Biological Evolution: Unity and Diversity; HS-LS4-5; HS-LS4-6HS-ESS2 Earthâ€™s Systems; HS-ESS2-4; HS-ESS2-6HS-ESS3 Earth and Human Activity; HS-ESS3-4; HS-ESS3-5 Keywords:marine debris, ocean stewardship, facilitated dialogue, biodiversity, ecosystem, human practices, ocean, marine biology
